flow-definition.description:
Prerequisite: 1. Host Being used for openstack should have all previous MAAS and Ceph pipeline executed. 2. Master file should exists. " /var/lib/jenkins/global_pipeline_parameters/master.properties having populated default Openstack values."(This will be on git once we have access to git from Jenkins box.)
Below tasks it will perform: 1. Prepare Openstack_user_config.yml, user_variable.yml and sso related yaml if selected for the entry provided by master file. 2. Update yml files related to Grafana, Prometheus and OpenStack exporter for container creation. 3. Updated http proxy to deployment host. 4. Ansible bootstrapping 5. Create secrets.yaml for openstack services 6. Move Updated yamls 7. Execute OSA playbooks 8. Create Prometheus/Grafana/Openstackexported contianers 9 . Copy and Install Monitoring role. 9. Below services will be deployed in HA. - Galera - Memcahce - Rabbitmq - Haparoxy - Keepaliave - Keystone - Cinder - Glance - Masakari - Nova - Neutron - Horizon

com.cwctravel.hudson.plugins.extended__c.name: DeploymentNodeIp
com.cwctravel.hudson.plugins.extended__c.description: This variable expects hostname or IP of the deployment node. This the node where OSA is installed for OpenStack deployment and other prerequisites like password-less connectivity from deployment node to other storage nodes is achieved.

com.cwctravel.hudson.plugins.extended__c.name: OSABranch
com.cwctravel.hudson.plugins.extended__c.description: OSA branch. which defines the version of Openstack to be installed.

com.cwctravel.hudson.plugins.extended__c.name: ContainerSubnet
com.cwctravel.hudson.plugins.extended__c.description: The Management Network, also referred to as the container network, provides management of and communication between the infrastructure and OpenStack services running in containers or on metal. The management network uses a dedicated VLAN typically connected to the br-mgmt bridge, and may also be used as the primary interface used to interact with the server via SSH.

com.cwctravel.hudson.plugins.extended__c.name: StorageNetwork
com.cwctravel.hudson.plugins.extended__c.description: The Storage Network provides segregated access to Block Storage from OpenStack services such as Cinder and Glance. The storage network uses a dedicated VLAN typically connected to the br-storage bridge.

com.cwctravel.hudson.plugins.extended__c.name: TunnelSubnet
com.cwctravel.hudson.plugins.extended__c.description: The Overlay Network, also referred to as the tunnel network, provides connectivity between hosts for the purpose of tunnelling encapsulated traffic using VXLAN, GENEVE, or other protocols. The overlay network uses a dedicated VLAN typically connected to the br-vxlan bridge

com.cwctravel.hudson.plugins.extended__c.name: UsedIPRange
com.cwctravel.hudson.plugins.extended__c.description: This list should include all IP addresses manually configured on target hosts, internal load balancers, service network bridge, deployment hosts and any other devices to avoid conflicts during the automatic IP address generation process for all above Subnet you have defined. Multiple values are accepted separated by colon , Example: 192.168.0.10,192.168.0.30:10.246.184.1,10.246.184.30:10.246.183.135,10.246.183.150

com.cwctravel.hudson.plugins.extended__c.name: InternalLBVip_address
com.cwctravel.hudson.plugins.extended__c.description: InternalLBVip_address, this address will be assigned to haproxy VIP and will be used by OS services for internal endpoints communications

com.cwctravel.hudson.plugins.extended__c.name: ExternalLBVip
com.cwctravel.hudson.plugins.extended__c.description: ExternalLBVip_address, this address will be assigned to haproxy VIP and will be used by OS services for external endpoints communication.

com.cwctravel.hudson.plugins.extended__c.name: ControllerNodes
com.cwctravel.hudson.plugins.extended__c.description: Enter the hostname controllers/infranodes separated by comma. For eg. sp-dev-infra1,sp-dev-infra2,sp-dev-infra3

com.cwctravel.hudson.plugins.extended__c.name: ComputeNodes
com.cwctravel.hudson.plugins.extended__c.description: Enter the hostname separated by comma. For eg.sp-dev-compute1,sp-dev-compute2,sp-dev-compute3

com.cwctravel.hudson.plugins.extended__c.name: ProxyUrl
com.cwctravel.hudson.plugins.extended__c.description: PROXY URL to be used for internet URL access, to download packages git clone etc.

com.cwctravel.hudson.plugins.extended__c.name: NtpServer
com.cwctravel.hudson.plugins.extended__c.description: Provide IP Address or name of NTP server present in the environment, multiple values can passed separated by comma

hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.name: openstack_service_publicuri_proto
hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.description: All the public service endpoint will be configured using selected protocol, make sure to use https if SSO will be configured

com.cwctravel.hudson.plugins.extended__c.name: KeepalivedPingAddress
com.cwctravel.hudson.plugins.extended__c.description: This can be IP address external to Openstack setup, it make sures that there is no split in keepalived and the node which is not able to reach this IP can consider it as failed

com.cwctravel.hudson.plugins.extended__c.name: CephMonIP
com.cwctravel.hudson.plugins.extended__c.description: Inputs the mons IPs of already deployed ceph cluster, multiple entries can be given in comma separated form eg:10.246.184.12,10.246.184.13,10.246.184.14

hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.name: UseSSO
hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.description: If you want SSO to be integrated with keystone keep it true, else select false.

com.cwctravel.hudson.plugins.extended__c.name: SsoVipAddress
com.cwctravel.hudson.plugins.extended__c.description: This is the frontendIP address of resolvable name for Single Sign-on Example: sso.cloud.gov.in

com.cwctravel.hudson.plugins.extended__c.name: IdpRealmName
com.cwctravel.hudson.plugins.extended__c.description: SSO has a configured realm name for the environment, Check with concern team

com.cwctravel.hudson.plugins.extended__c.name: OidcClientId
com.cwctravel.hudson.plugins.extended__c.description: Update the OIDC client ID, you can get this from IDP

hudson.model.PasswordParameterDefinition.name: OidcClientSecret
hudson.model.PasswordParameterDefinition.description: Input the secret for user defined in sp_oidc_client_id

hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.name: Playbook
hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.description: In case of re-run one can select specific playbook to start execution with, default is setup-everything.yml
